physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Right eye: visual acuities (VAs) 0.3 (20/70); left eye: no light perception (LP). Large retinal hemangioblastomas in the right eye (4 lesions, measuring 2 to 3 disc diameters), well-defined feeder vessels, tractional and exudative retinal detachments. Left eye: severe tractional RD extending to macula, plus hemorrhages.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vision in the right eye improved from 0.3 (20/70) to 0.5 (20/40) three months post-surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Vision 1.2 (20/16) right eye and 0.4 (20/50) left eye. Multiple retinal hemangioblastomas in right eye, three large hemangioblastomas in left eye with large feeder vessels surrounded by serous detachment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vision worsened from 0.4 (20/50) to 0.2 (20/100) two months after surgery due to epiretinal membrane formation and recurrent RD.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Vision LP right eye, 1.5 (20/15) left eye. 3-DD retinal hemangioblastoma in right eye surrounded by exudates and small hemorrhages; tractional RD, lipid exudates in a star configuration.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vision improved from LP to 0.2 (20/100) three months post-surgery; number of hard macular exudates decreased.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Vision 0.6 (20/33) right eye, 1.2 (20/16) left eye. Round, 4-DD elevated vascular lesion in right eye surrounded by exudates and serous RD. No significant retinal or vitreal traction.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vision recovered from 0.6 (20/33) to 0.9 (20/25) three months after surgery.
